{"step_by_step_thinking": "Antenatal corticosteroids are administered to pregnant women at risk of preterm birth to accelerate fetal lung maturation and reduce the incidence and severity of respiratory distress syndrome. If the pregnancy continues after the administration of antenatal corticosteroids, it provides an opportunity for a rescue dose if the risk of preterm birth persists. Therefore, the continuation of pregnancy after antenatal corticosteroid administration can indeed be an opportunity for rescue.", "answer_choice": "A. yes"}
